duties_responsibilities.duty: Identify and close new business opportunities within established and new accounts in a geographically dispersed territory.
Focus call activities on multi-specialty ambulatory surgery centers (ASCs) and hospitals within assigned accounts.
Establish and maintain customer relationships and overall financial performance within assigned territory through consultative and clinical value-based selling.
Develop and implement territory sales strategy and plan for local hospitals and IDN accounts not covered by the Corporate Accounts teams.
Conduct product demonstration, training presentations, and in-servicing based upon Customer’s needs.
Anticipate customer needs, develop innovative solutions to streamline customer workflows, and think creatively to identify new revenue streams.
Continually acquire, maintain, and expand personal understanding of features, benefits, applications, and market conditions, enhancing the needs for our current and future products.
Participate in local chapters AORN, IAHCSMM, SGNA, and/or other relevant organizations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Minimum of 3 years of sales experience, or 2 years of medical sales experience, or 1 year of sales experience plus 1 year of infection prevention industry experience.
Experience prospecting for new business and cold calling.
Preferred experience selling to hospitals, ASC’s, and Inpatient/Outpatient Endoscopy Suites.
Candidates must possess a valid driver's license issued in the United States.
The ability to travel based on the requirements of the role. Must live in or be willing to relocate within defined territory.
